topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5467cdb26368725dfe540000#post_5467cdb26368725dfe540000
I had the first and second gen toys. I have the first one still but I gave the second gen one to my cousin because it wasn't screen accurate enough for me as a kid. 

Now I feel like an idiot because that thing's worth a fortune now. 

I also have the sixth gen one but it's not an actual pokedex. It's just a clear piece of plastic with a spinny light thing.

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5467cedc6368724a3d3e0200#post_5467cedc6368724a3d3e0200
Some toy lines are better than they've ever been nowadays. Transformers for example are insanely complex and so much more sturdy than the old ones. 

But then pokemon has a super crap toyline. The mini figures are about the same as they used to be but there isn't really much more to it.

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5467d8fa6368727395540100#post_5467d8fa6368727395540100
I remember playing around with touchscreen electronic toys as a kid during the late 90s. There were also certain advice machines in my grocery store pharmacy that had touchscreen, until me and my brother played the hell out of it like a toy everytime my parents went to get their prescription that they got rid of it. I doubt that was the real reason, but yeah, we were bored...
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc
